comments.author: jasa.david@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110721 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110711084256

Steps to reproduce:

SSIA. Reproducer:

1. install ForceTLS addon: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/force-tls/
2. in ForceTLS configuration, add *.zuno.cz to site list
3. start network capture
4. go to www.zuno.cz



Actual results:

* network capture shows that all network traffic is actually performed over TLS - correct
* the icon to the left of URL indicates the page as partially encrypted - fail


Expected results:

* the page should be indicated as fully encrypted
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110721 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110711084256

Steps to reproduce:

SSIA. Reproducer:

1. install ForceTLS addon: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/force-tls/
2. in ForceTLS configuration, add *.zuno.cz to site list
3. start network capture
4. go to www.zuno.cz



Actual results:

* network capture shows that all network traffic is actually performed over TLS - correct
* the icon to the left of URL indicates the page as partially encrypted - fail


Expected results:

* the page should be indicated as fully encrypted
comments.creator: jasa.david@gmail.com

comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
visiting https://www.zuno.cz/ with FF6.01 on win32 and without addon shows the page as full encrypted.
That looks like an addon bug to me.
comments.raw_text:
visiting https://www.zuno.cz/ with FF6.01 on win32 and without addon shows the page as full encrypted.
That looks like an addon bug to me.
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de

comments.raw_text:
WFM too against the HTTPs Site.
Even when using Kai's https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/padlock-icon/ Addon what exposes partial encrypted Sites with an Icon.
